title: I've been critical of Riot's last few choices, but Bard looks good.
body:
Far less straightforward mechanics, less correct decisions, more ambiguous abilities. Less damage, more unique effects.

A little overloaded maybe (Double passive again, and I don't really see why his auto attacks need to get stronger) but it looks like a champion that not only plays differently, but brings something that you can't directly numerically compare to the table.

First bit of strategic diversity I've been pretty impressed with.

replies.body:
I think they only gave him the Meep passive (yes, that is what it is called guys, look it up) because he only has 1, count it ***1***, damaging ability in his whole kit. Even a super squishy "no damage" support like Soraka has more damage abilities than him, so they were probably trying to find a simple way to give him at least mediocre damage as the game progresses, so that he doesn't become a non factor when alone.

I am SO excited for this guy though, his kit looks like a combination of a ton of really cool ideas I've seen floating around for ages (like health packs and passing through walls as a team), and I'm really glad they are finally making it into the game.

That's pretty accurate. Meeps damage is there, and scales over the course of the game, in part to offset Bard's lack of other damaging abilities and the way some of his skills (E especially, W and R to a lesser degree) lack immediate combat impact.

Meeps also give a clear, discreet way of providing power from his collection game, adding some different decision making and optimisation into how that power's used (rather than giving raw stats, which can also be an appropriate choice but is something we've already got on offer on other champions).

 Not really... They are two separate things... Meeps come regardless of whether you collect anything or not. Chimes have to be physically picked up. Meeps also appear more frequently as the game progresses... while chimes appear with the same consistency throughout.

If chimes became meeps, that also means you get all the chime buff plus the meeps at the exact same time and maybe that's not the way Riot has intended them to work.

While I like your idea of condensing two things down to one... in this situation it really doesn't work.

It could have easily been spun that way. The number of meeps depends on the number of chimes anyway.

Meeps are naturally drawn to him, but he could also go looking for them. They could have different effects dependinjg on whether thwy find Bard, or Bard finds them. The biggest difference would be that he can actively increase the number of available Meeps, which could be adjusted my lowering the number of drawn in meeps.

I can be adjusted to be very little difference in gameplay, but it would be a bit more rounded thematically. That is unless the chimes have a symbolic meaning I'm missing.

We did look at whether Bard should collect Meeps directly. That lead to situations where Bard went through extended periods of no Meeps at all however if unable to roam sufficiently. It also left Bards feeling they had to try for a kill immediately on returning to lane (otherwise he either never auto attacked or would spend his Meeps before he really wanted them). Very boom or bust gameplay and we do want the Meeps to offer a consistent contribution to Bard, given his non combat/non damage tools as above.

Bard's AA steroid serves the exact same role as Sona's AA steroid: Increasing harassment potential. Bard is a harassment support: He doesn't really have the raw defense to protect an ally nor the hard CC to lock them down outside of his ult. His job is to win a war of attrition and wander around providing pressure to lanes: Because he only has the one damaging ability, he needs something to help him out with that goal outside of just cranking up the damage on that one ability. *cough {{champion:26}} cough*

I hate the complaints about "Oh man, this champion has *two* passives, so OP, so complex!" It's the world's dumbest complaint. Do not judge a champion on its parts: Judge a champion on its whole. Does Bard, as a whole, seem OP? Does Bard, as a whole, seem overly complex? No. Not really. So it doesn't matter how many passives he has so long as those two lines aren't crossed. He could have a dozen passives, but as long as they were all simple, minor, and serve his character concept, *it doesn't fucking matter.* Complain about things that are actually a problem, like the ability to assassinate targets while building tanky, or the ability to escape from every fight, or the fact that an ability ostensibly about displacement and disruption has been reduced to a single target execution due to its stupid scaling.

Yes I am talking about single-passive-having Lee Sin right now.

He isn't a harras-support,he is a raoming support.

He does have hard CC,his Q(which can be a double stun..)
He has a single, highly situational hard CC and even if he's roaming, he's still going to be *harassing* while roaming, which is *the entire reason he roams.*

We're hoping to see some other reasons to roam a bit as well too, whether that's throwing down Shrines in other lanes until needed, helping your jungler bypass walls, warding deeper than you normally would or whatever. Really interested to see what people make of this guy and how his toolkit gets used.
Do you have any worry that he'll be out of lane so often that he'll fall behind in experience? Do you worry that experience loss will hold him back from committing to his roams?

There's experience on Chime pick up in part to avoid that problem, so that spending more time out of lane than normal (up to a limit of course, eventually you run out of Chimes to collect) feels rewarding rather than punishing.

Im asking because ill be buying him (and probably his alt skin) on release and playing the hell out of him for the next month or year depending on his roaming mechanic. Chimes spawn in semi random locations at fairly regular intervals. They'll keep doing so as long as the game lasts. If all you're doing is collecting Chimes however you'll be spending a lot of time waiting and not doing anything (you'll temporarily run out of new ones to collect), which is why we're expecting Bard players to still spend a lot of time doing other stuff.
